arguments.title: Real-time Notifications: WebSockets vs Polling Decision
arguments.content:
The team has decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for the real-time notification feature. 

**Tradeoffs Considered:**

* **WebSockets Advantages:**
  - Lower latency: Instant updates when events occur rather than waiting for poll intervals
  - More efficient: Reduced server load from constant polling requests
  - Better user experience: Real-time feedback without manual refreshes
  - Bidirectional communication: Enables server-to-client and client-to-server messaging

* **Polling Advantages:**
  - Simpler to implement in some environments with strict firewall rules
  - More widely supported in older browser versions (though WebSockets support is now standard)
  
* **Decision Rationale:**
  The benefits of lower latency, better efficiency, and improved user experience outweigh the implementation complexity of WebSockets. Modern browser support makes this a viable choice for our target audience.
